_header: With my true heart content of joy and weal
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, a roundel, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 113) — 14 lines.

BLHar682.First Lines:
WIth my trewe hert content of ioy & weleMi fayre maystres myn
                    hertis sovl desere…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…Thenke how y serue yow be y fer or nereWhat so me happe in
                    seeknes or in hele
BLHar682.Note: As written, repeats first words of lines 1-2 at end to indicate going back to first four lines of the roundel. F. 74* follows f. 74, so this record should follow 2649.
BLHar682.Facsimiles:
